output.conclusion: This workshop technology course provides a foundational understanding of common workshop tools and practices. Further learning and hands-on experience are recommended to develop proficiency.
output.introduction: Welcome to the Workshop Technology course! This course will introduce you to the fundamental tools and techniques used in a typical workshop environment. No prior experience is required.

chapters.description: Overview of general safety rules, personal protective equipment (PPE) such as safety glasses and gloves, and hazard identification in a workshop.
Introduction to different types of screwdrivers (Phillips, flathead), proper usage, and selecting the right screwdriver for the job.
Introduction to different types of wrenches (open-end, box-end, adjustable), proper usage, and selecting the right wrench for the job.

modules.moduleTitle: Workshop Safety and Basic Hand Tools

chapters.chapterTitle: Measuring Tools: Rulers and Tape Measures
chapters.description: Introduction to rulers and tape measures, reading measurements (inches, centimeters), and accurate measuring techniques.
Introduction to calipers (inside, outside, depth), reading measurements, and using calipers for precise measurements.
Introduction to different types of pencils and markers used for marking materials, and techniques for accurate marking.
Introduction to different types of screws and bolts, selecting the right fastener for the job, and using screws and bolts effectively.
Introduction to different types of nails, using a hammer to drive nails, and techniques for secure nailing.
Introduction to different types of glues and tapes, selecting the right adhesive for the job, and applying adhesives effectively.
Introduction to different types of hand saws (rip saw, crosscut saw), proper usage, and cutting techniques.
Introduction to utility knives, safe usage, and changing blades.
Introduction to files, different types of files, and using files for shaping and smoothing materials.
Overview of drilling safety, parts of a drill, and selecting the right drill bit for the material.
Proper techniques for drilling straight holes, using a drill press (if available), and drilling different materials.
Introduction to sandpaper grits, hand sanding techniques, and using a sanding block.
